Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: MACERAL ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: A Unique observation number forthe maceral analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: LITHOLOGY DESCRIPTION: A narrative description about the lithology of themaceral.
Column Comment.7: MACERAL AMOUNT TYPE: The type of amount of the maceral substance in therow. For example, the amount could be abundant, sufficient, rare, sparse, etc.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not maceral analysis ispreferred.
Column Comment.10: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SAMPLE TOTAL MACERAL VALUE: The total value of the maceral sample.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample.
Column Comment.16: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Beadvised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.17: TOTAL MACERAL VALUE: The total maceral value of the amount in this row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
